medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute epigastric pain after breakfast, sharp, stabbing, and constant with associated nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed symptoms acutely upon awakening this morning. The pain radiates to both sides and is described as sharp and stabbing. The patient has had similar episodes of pain before, but states they did not last this long. The last bowel movement was normal without blood. No fevers reported, but there are positive subjective chills.
medical_history.past_medical_history: GERD, Anxiety, Obesity, Allergic sinusitis, Hypertension, Hepatitis C, Thyroid nodule, Osteoporosis, Vertigo, Colonic adenoma.
medical_history.family_history: Father died at old age, mother is alive and well; three children - two sons and one daughter.
